experience: You and Molly both know John McLaughlin
This week in the Mind-Body-Spirit of Success: Why Persistence is the Best Daily Practice

As a strategist for business and creatives, I find that persistence in perspective separates the most successful and happy folks from those who may be financially successful but inherently insecure in what they are here to offer the world. What does that mean? That having a clear and consistent point of view is the key to a path of joy, even in the face of the big changes and the unraveling of old systems and beliefs in our world. Â Read more at the blog:Â http://bit.ly/2ghWcIR
This looks pretty good right here...
Interesting talk about VR, AI and the cinematic world of Ready Player One with screen writer Zak Penn.

I just got an invitation to attend this Cloud Conference. I have no idea how they found me. I'm not a tech person though I like to learn new things. I took an online Social Media Marketing class a while ago and learned a bit about Big Data. Perhaps, they got my email from that class. I was at the Digital Hollywood Conference yesterday and met Molly Lavik, creator of #AIShowBizEvent and told her about my upcoming book. She asked if I'd blog about her event and I agreed. So, stay tuned.Â https://lnkd.in/ugNn4P

recommendations: Constantine Roussos
Founder at .MUSIC (DotMusic)
April 24, 2008, Molly worked with Constantine in the same group

Molly has been a source of inspiration for me in regards to socially responsible business practices. I had the pleasure of working with Molly in numerous occassions when she cordially invited me as a guest speaker at Pepperdine University. Her Mentorography and StartUp Time projects are both innovative and praiseworthy. Molly is a rare individual and I will continue to be supportive in her commendable work. Highly recommended!

Director of Marketing at Spring Gardens Detox |
Co-Founder of AddictionUnscripted.Com I Influencer  I Miracle Maker
February 10, 2007, Lara was a client of Mollyâ€™s

Molly is one of the most exceptional faculty members at the Pepperdine University Graziadio School of Business & Management. As a student in her Marketing New Ventures class, I had the opportunity to experience her unique and vibrant spirit as well as witness firsthand her ability to create inventive and out-of-the-box ideas for class curriculum. Molly always went above and beyond from bringing in valuable guest speakers to the class to offering her time and expert advice in the career search and beyond. Molly truly impacted my experience at Pepperdine and made me realize how lucky I was to have had the chance to take one of her classes as well as know her on a more personal level. She is amazing!

Kathryn Fitzgerald, Ph.D.
Marketing Strategy and Customer Insight Consultant
January 2, 2007, Molly worked with Kathryn in the same group

Molly was a fantastic colleague.  She's both creative and detail-oriented, but she truly distinguished herself in her dedication and willingness to take on just about any task--she went well above and beyond the scope of her formal responsibilites on many, many occasions.  She cares a great deal for students, and was a pleasure to work with.  Molly's connections and ability to bring in accomplished guest speakers added greatly to courses she taught.  I would highly recommend her for any position, and consider her a trusted personal friend.

summary: Founder of Mentor InSight which is a consulting and media company that is dedicated to empowering access to success by providing the knowledge you need to superachieve via forums, panels and events. Instrumental in helping the economic development in the digital media industry and the sustainable business industry. Specialties: Experienced in the economic development of the digital media and sustainable business industries in California, expertise in devising commercial applications for digital media technologies, known for being an innovative curriculum creator for professional development forums, expert at fundraising, producing experiential marketing campaigns and events and accomplished early-stage entrepreneurship coach.Also working with visionary board of directors to assist with running the premiere sustainable Southern California educational nonprofit, Sustainable Business Council, whose mission is to provide professional networking, mentoring, and educational forums to sustainable business professionals in Southern California. The organization's goal is to help members improve their operating efficiencies, profit margins, and staff productivity as they reduce the ecological impact of their products and services.Sustainable Marketing Consultant specializing in sustainable startups and the digital media industry; Previously, Practitioner Faculty of Marketing for MBA-level marketing and entrepreneurship courses at Pepperdine University's Graziadio School of Business and Management. Also, published author of biographies, known as "Mentorographies," on well-known entrepreneurs. Focused on helping entrepreneurs improve their startup success rate. Longterm Mentor InSight Goal: To facilitate the development of AI technologies that would enable an Obi-Wan Kenobi style hologram guru that you could beam into the palm of your hand for advice on anything, anywhere at anytime.
name: Molly Lavik
title: Founder, Mentor InSight, Inc.
